## What?

- Tidy data of folklore taxonomies and annotated texts
- A common platform for reproducible research
- Open for use with a [CC BY-SA 4.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/) license
- Available on [GitHub](https://github.com/j-hagedorn/trilogy)

## Contents

- `tmi`: the *Thompson Motif Index*
- `atu`: the *Aarne-Thompson-Uther* Tale Type Index
- `aft`: some *Annotated Folktales*, initially seeded with [D.L. Ashlimanâ€™s corpus](https://sites.pitt.edu/~dash/folktexts.html)

## Purpose

- Promote [reproducible research](https://doi.org/10.1146/annurev-publhealth-012420-105110) of folklore narrative
- Less data cleaning, more analysis
- [Let even distant teams collaborate simultaneously](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/start-your-journey/about-github-and-git)
- Extensible base of knowledge *via* user contributions

## How you can help

- [Filing issues](https://github.com/j-hagedorn/trilogy/issues/new) if you find errors or have suggestions
- Submitting manual corrections as needed
- [Annotating tales](https://github.com/j-hagedorn/trilogy/blob/master/docs/vignettes/getting_started.md#growing-and-refining-the-corpus) and adding to the corpus
